text.value: Milton’s choice of the Parable of the Talents as a prism through which to contemplate his relationship with God is significant. Most Christian theologians accept that the absent lord represents God. But the idea of God as the stern master – the “hard man” as the King James Bible has it – who treats an imprudent or unfortunate servant so harshly is somewhat alarming. The sentence passed upon him – jumbled up below – is especially unforgiving. Rearrange the word order to render the punishment he is given:
opens with an imperative and ends in an equivalent to blindness
